messages.title: Standing up for Rochester and Strood
messages.content: Our community needs a strong local voice

messages.title: My pledges to you
messages.content: Stand up for your local NHS, Fight to bring down the cost of utilities, Back local schools and make education a top priority, Work for a firm but fair stance on immigration, Support housing development that works for our community

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stand up for your local NHS services and secure the future of Medway Hospital.
Fight to bring down the cost of utilities for local residents because we all need and play by the rules, but deserve to feel the benefits.
Back local schools and make education a top priority - Labour will ensure a qualified teacher in every classroom.
Work for a firm but fair stance on immigration - we can celebrate diversity but don't have a divided community.
Support housing development that works for our community, not harms it.

mentions.candidate: I understand the issues that really matter here. I have worked in education and healthcare and if you work hard and play by the rules, you deserve to feel the benefits.

issues.education: ensure a qualified teacher in every classroom
issues.health: secure the future of Medway Hospital
issues.immigration: celebrate diversity but don't have a divided community

housing.content: Support housing development that works for our community, not harms it.

leaflet.personalStatement: There's a reason I care about Rochester and Strood. I was born at the All Saints Hospital, went to school at Fort Pitt Grammar and Rochester Math. I have lived in the Medway Towns all my life so I understand the issues that really matter here. In recent years working people have paid the cost of living.
